answers.answer: It's impossible to answer your question because your post is filled with assumptions and zero facts. If you can answer the questions following we will be better equipped to answer you.1.  "bought myself a monitor seems fine all day".What does "seems" mean? What are your test results numbers? And when are you performing these tests?2. "first thing in morning before breakfast the reading is over the request range."Tell us what this "request range" is?3. "i eat protien only,"Not a healthy diet. Being disabled doesn't prevent one from eating proper nutrition, that is, unless you have food allergies that restrict you from eating nothing but protein. If so, you need to post on the nutrition forum for advice.Also, your Diabetes Tracker requires test inputs in mg/dl, the numbers you posted [6 & 7] are incorrect values and appear to be mmol/l. Do you have your meter set to read in mmol/l [European] or mg/dl [American] l=L [EL] not 1 [one]?Finally, have you seen a doctor for proper diabetes testing - OGTT and A1c?

question: i have been told i am at risk of getting diabetes.  bought myself a monitorseems fine all day. but first thing in morning before breakfast the reading is over the request range. is there anything i could do to remedy this.i eat protien only,  every three hours very small amount as i am overweight. no excersise as i am disabledsleep very well usually 8 hours a night. no thirst problems
title: pre diabetic 55yrs old female
